revised_title: The Earth's Core: Role of Rotation in Generating Magnetic Fields
tldr: This article explores the role of rotation in the generation of magnetic fields by fluid motions in the Earth's core. The authors discuss the importance of Coriolis forces due to the Earth's rotation and how they affect fluid dynamics, leading to the formation of magnetic fields. They also highlight the significance of studying such flows in understanding the Earth's magnetic field and its evolution.
